js
Class JSPrintPreview

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      js.JSPrintPreview
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JSPrintPreview
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.print.Printable, java.awt.event.ActionListener

JSPrintPreview provides a 'print preview' interface for printing a document using Java. A JDialog is created with a simulation of an A4 piece of paper and some tools for zooming, printing and showing a grid. The instance of JSPrintPreview uses methods similar to that of a Graphics2D object, such as drawString and drawImage.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Josh Sunshine
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

display

public void display()
Causes the preview dialog to appear on-screen. This method should be called last, after adding all components.

setOrientation

public void setOrientation(int orientation)
Sets whether the simulated paper should be in portrait or landscape mode.

Parameters:
orientation - the new orientation for the simulated paper. Either PORTRAIT_ORIENTATION or LANDSCAPE_ORIENTATION.

setGrid

public void setGrid(java.lang.Boolean show)
Sets whether or not the grid should be shown as soon as the preview is displayed.

Parameters:
show - the state of the grid. true will show the grid and false will hide the grid.

setCurrencySymbol

public void setCurrencySymbol(java.lang.String currencySymbol)
Sets the symbol to be used when drawing currencies.

drawString

public void drawString(java.lang.String string,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Renders a string on the paper.

Parameters:
string - the string to be rendered.
x - the x-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the string's destination.
y - the y-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the string's destination.

drawString

public void drawString(java.lang.Object object,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Converts the passed object to a string and renders it on the paper.

Parameters:
object - the object to be rendered.
x - the x-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the object's destination.
y - the y-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the object's destination.

drawString

public void drawString(java.lang.Object object,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int alignment)
Converts the passed object to a string and renders it on the paper with the specified text alignment.

Parameters:
object - the object to be rendered.
x - the x-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the object's destination.
y - the y-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the object's destination.
alignment - the horizontal alignment of the rendered text. Pass 0 for left alignment or 1 for right alignment.

drawCurrency

public void drawCurrency(double value,
                         int x,
                         int y)
Rounds the passed number to two decimal places, appends the chosen currencySymbol to the beginning, and renders the result on the paper with a right alignment.

Parameters:
value - the value to be rendered.
x - the x-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the number's destination.
y - the y-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the number's destination.
See Also:
setCurrencySymbol(String currencySymbol)

drawCurrency

public void drawCurrency(double value,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int alignment)
Rounds the passed number to two decimal places, appends the chosen currencySymbol to the beginning, and renders the result on the paper with the chosen alignment.

Parameters:
value - the value to be rendered.
x - the x-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the number's destination.
y - the y-coordinate, measured in pixels from the top-left corner of the page, of the number's destination.
alignment - alignment the horizontal alignment of the rendered text. Pass 0 for left alignment or 1 for right alignment.
See Also:
